node.title: Criminal probe opened into stampede at rap concert that left 8 dead
node.description: A criminal investigation has been opened after a stampede during rap star Travis Scott's Astroworld music festival in Houston killed at least eight people

node.title: Prince Charles to visit Barbados to mark republic's birth
node.description: Prince Charles will travel to Barbados to mark the Caribbean island's transition to a republic which entails the removal of Queen Elizabeth as head of state.

node.title: No sign of shark attack victim as search continues
node.description: There is still no sign of a man believed to have been taken by a shark at Port Beach in Western Australia on Saturday morning.

node.title: Sydney to further ease Covid-19 curbs as vaccinations pick up
node.description: Sydney will further ease social distancing curbs tomorrow, a month after emerging from a coronavirus lockdown that lasted nearly 100 days, as close to 90 percent of people have got both doses of…

node.title: Attempted assassination against Iraq's prime minister fails
node.description: An explosive-laden drone has targeted the Iraqi prime minister's residence in what the country's military say was an unsuccessful assassination attempt.

node.title: Founding member of band UB40 dies at 64
node.description: British vocalist and founding member of UB40 Terence Wilson, better known by his stage name Astro, has died aged 64. Video

node.title: Northern Ireland row puts UK-EU trade deal under threat
node.description: Former UK Prime Minister Sir John Major warns suspending parts of the Northern Ireland Protocol Brexit deal would be a "colossally stupid" move.

node.title: Rittenhouse said he 'had to shoot' after opening fire, jury hears
node.description: Shortly after opening fire during racial justice protests in Wisconsin in 2020, teenager Kyle Rittenhouse told a witness in his murder trial that he had no choice but to use his semi-automatic rifle…

node.title: Hamilton train to run to central Auckland when service resumes
node.description: The Hamilton to Auckland commuter train will travel direct into central Auckland once the service resumes.

node.title: AstraZeneca vaccine will soon be available for some - Bloomfield
node.description: The Director-General of Health says for the "few hundred people" in NZ who could not have the Pfizer vaccine "for medical reasons" there was the option of AstraZeneca.

node.title: Company director jailed for sharing child sex abuse material
node.description: A Hamilton man has been jailed for sharing child sexual abuse material online.

node.title: Covid-19: 147 new community cases today, another death in home isolation
node.description: There have been 147 new cases of Covid-19 reported in the community today - including 14 in Waikato - with another death of someone with Covid-19 who was isolating at home.

node.title: DOC to stop waiving concession fees for tourism operators
node.description: Tourism leaders are warning businesses may fold after the Department of Conservation announced it will stop waiving concession fees.

node.title: Person with Covid visited Taranaki at start of November, DHB believes
node.description: Recent wastewater results suggest a Covid-infectious person was in Taranaki from the start of November, the region's top doctor says.

node.title: School reeling after three staff die in crash
node.description: The principal of a New Plymouth school which has lost three staff members in a horror crash in Horowhenua says the community is reeling at the news.

node.title: School's (almost) back: 'Anything we can do to get them back there safely is fine with us'
node.description: It's been three months since most Auckland students have been in the classroom, one parent says learning from home hasn't been easy for anyone.
